Anderson School District Five Culinary Services will provide meals to Anderson Five Virtual Academy (A5VA) students during the 2020-2021 school year. Meals will be available for pick-up Mondays through Fridays from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at the following locations:

• Robert Anderson Middle School
• Glenview Middle School
• Whitehall Elementary School
• Calhoun Academy of the Arts

Anderson Five Virtual Academy Update:

Immediately effective due to a directive from Superintendent Wilson, Anderson Five will allow requests for semester-by-semester enrollment in the Anderson Five Virtual Academy for 2020-2021. Students enrolled in the Anderson Five Virtual Academy will have the opportunity to switch to in-person learning at their home school at the end of first semester which is February 3, 2021. Anderson Five will also consider new enrollment into the Anderson Five Virtual Academy from in-person learning at the end of the first semester on February 3, 2021. Parents will be asked to give notification of intent for second semester enrollment by December 4, 2020.

Parents should be aware that the Anderson Five Virtual Academy instructional platform, Calvert and Edmentum, is based on South Carolina standards, but they do not follow the same pacing guide and sequence as the courses in our schools. Any switch from the Anderson Five Virtual Academy to in-person instruction, and vice versa, may lead to student learning gaps.

Permanently established in 1975 by an act of Congress, National School Breakfast Week is a weeklong celebration of the National School Breakfast Program. 🥛🍌🥞🥓🍳

• Higher levels of achievement in Math and Reading subjects 📚
• Higher scores on standardized tests 📝

• Increased alertness 💡

Board Meeting - January 2020
.
.
.
Anderson Five Board of Trustees proudly recognized the excellence of T.L. Hanna High School staff and students at this month's Board meeting!

Congratulations to Kathy Moore, Art teacher at TLH and recipient of the 2019 Mary Whyte Art Educator Award; as well as to Rob Spencer, Physics teacher, Coach at TLH and recipient of the Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching (PAEMST).

We also congratulate the students and staff of the T.L. Hanna FIzzer Factory, which was named Employer of the Year by the South Carolina Council for Exceptional Children at the Transition Alliance of South Carolina statewide conference this past Fall. Each Board member along with Superintendent Wilson were thrilled to receive their very own Bath Fizzer and check out the student-run business products themselves!

Congratulations and thank you to all! Well-deserved!
#vision5 #committedtoexcellence
